security_audit.summary: The static analyzer flagged 20 potential issues, but all are false positives. The flagged items are standard JSON metadata fields (URLs, hashes, description text) and generic documentation keywords that the scanner misinterpreted. This skill is a read-only knowledge-loading skill with no executable code, network access, file writes, or command execution. Only Read and Grep tools are allowed.

content.value_statement: This skill provides access to common code patterns and abstractions used in your project. It ensures consistent implementation across features by loading established patterns for data access, API design, components, state management, and error handling.
actual_capabilities: Load data access patterns from project knowledge base
limitations: Does not execute or modify code
Requires patterns.json file to exist in memory/knowledge

use_cases.title: New feature implementation
use_cases.description: Load established patterns before implementing new features to maintain consistency with existing codebase.

use_cases.title: Onboarding assistance
use_cases.description: Understand project conventions by loading pattern files that document how to structure code.

use_cases.title: Consistency verification
use_cases.description: Reference pattern documentation to verify implementations follow established abstractions.

prompt_templates.title: Load patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the patterns skill and show me the data access patterns for this project.

prompt_templates.title: API design
prompt_templates.prompt: Using the API design patterns from the patterns skill, how should I structure this new endpoint?

prompt_templates.title: Component structure
prompt_templates.prompt: What component patterns does this project use? Show me examples from the patterns skill.

prompt_templates.title: Error handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the error handling patterns. How should I handle errors in this new service?

output_examples.input: Load the patterns skill and show me the data access patterns
output: Repository pattern - Single point of data access with consistent error handling
Query object pattern - Encapsulate complex queries as reusable objects
Unit of work pattern - Coordinate multiple repository changes atomically
Data mapper pattern - Separate domain objects from database schema

output_examples.input: What API design patterns does this project use?
output: RESTful endpoints - Consistent URL structure with proper HTTP verbs
Error responses - Standardized error format with codes and messages
Versioning strategy - API versioning through URL prefix or header
Authentication flow - Consistent auth pattern across all endpoints

best_practices: Load patterns before implementing features to understand project conventions
Cross-reference patterns with existing code to verify alignment
Update pattern documentation when introducing new abstractions
anti_patterns: Ignoring established patterns and introducing inconsistent implementations
Modifying pattern files without reviewing impact across the codebase
Creating new patterns without documenting them in the knowledge base

faq.question: What tools can use this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It requires no additional configuration.

faq.question: What are the pattern categories?
faq.answer: Categories include data access, API design, components, state management, and error handling patterns.

faq.question: How do patterns integrate with existing code?
faq.answer: Patterns are loaded into context and used as reference guides for implementing consistent abstractions.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads pattern documentation and never writes, modifies, or transmits data.

faq.question: Why are patterns not loading?
faq.answer: Ensure the patterns.json file exists in memory/knowledge/codebase/ and contains valid pattern definitions.

faq.question: How is this different from conventions?
faq.answer: Patterns show how to structure code. Conventions specify style rules. Use patterns for architecture decisions.
